intro: Lomatogonium thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
